interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Valentine's Day Review Date: 2010/12/26 Store: Bradley Cooper (Actor), Jennifer Garner (Actor), Garry Marshall (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'The starriest cast you may ever see sparkles in a hilarious and heartwarming romcom from the director of Pretty Woman and The Princess Diaries. Stories crisscross, collide and boomerang in this look at a day in the life of love. There\'s a proposal. Flowers that didn\'t get sent. A big fat secret that\'s finally told. The "I\'ll show up and surprise him" that ended up surprising her. Fights, kisses, wrong turns, right moves and more. Whether new to or through with love, you\'ll fall in love with this 19-star, funny-side-up celebration of romance.', 'Amazon.com', "For those in love with love--and even for those who think they're jaded and over it--", "Valentine's Day", "and its superb cast are the uplifting elixir that's called for. Director Garry Marshall must have called in every favor he had in Hollywood to line up this amazing cast. Much as Robert Altman does in his best films, Marshall follows intertwining and intersecting couples around Los Angeles as they hook up, break up, and act up as Valentine's Day--with all its intense expectations--looms. Bradley Cooper plays one half of a couple struggling to get back on track. Julia Roberts plays an army officer en route from Iraq (!) to visit a lover halfway around the world. Jennifer Garner is appealing as the girlfriend of a cad (Patrick Dempsey), who managed to overlook telling her he was married; will Garner's character go all", 'Fatal Attraction', "? Standouts include the always-charming Anne Hathaway, whose character supplements her income with a freelance gig that, shall we say, involves using multiple accents over the phone--much to the consternation of her beau, played by Topher Grace. Shirley MacLaine and Hector Elizondo play a long-married couple whose strong marriage may be rocked by an old and very inconvenient truth. And young stars Emma Roberts, Taylor Lautner, and Taylor Swift sparkle enough to draw in younger viewers. And if love doesn't always go as planned for these couples (and singles), it's Marshall's deftness as a director that keeps the scenes moving along crisply to the next lovers, or victims. Marshall seems to be aiming to achieve for Valentine's Day what Richard Curtis did for Christmas in", 'Love Actually', '--and if he falls a little short, it\'s not due to any lack of star power or onscreen dazzle. "Love is the only shocking act left on the planet!" exclaims Ashton Kutcher\'s character. If so, viewers of', "Valentine's Day", 'can expect to be shocked--into a warm romance with this, yes, valentine to love. --', 'A.T. Hurley'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama/Love & Romance, Comedy', 'Format': 'Color, Multiple Formats, AC-3, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Dubbed, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Taylor Swift, Jamie Foxx, Jessica Alba, Taylor Lautner, Julia Roberts, Anne Hathaway, Garry Marshall, Jessica Biel, Jennifer Garner, Bradley Cooper, Kathy BatesTaylor Swift, Jamie Foxx, Jessica Alba, Taylor Lautner, Julia Roberts, Anne Hathaway, Garry Marshall, Jessica Biel, Jennifer Garner, Bradley Cooper, Kathy Bates See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.25 x 5.75 x 0.25 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'NEWL1000117450DVD', 'Director': 'Garry Marshall', 'Media Format': 'Color, Multiple Formats, AC-3, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Dubbed, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 18, 2010', 'Actors': 'Bradley Cooper, Jennifer Garner, Taylor Swift, Jamie Foxx, Jessica Alba', 'Dubbed': 'French, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Studio': 'New Line Cinema', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Okay, I HAD to see this movie.
Valentine's Day is my favorite holiday.
I love romantic comedies.
Then all the cast - geez, so many stars!

But, the movie was a little boring, to be honest.
I liked it, and yes, I'd watch it again, but it doesn't have any
of the staying power (Ie - want to watch repeatedly) of movies like
"Sleepless in Seattle". They could have done SO much more with the stories.
I would have loved to have the movie be longer and more interesting.

If you can get it really cheaply, or collect movies with a certain star
in them, then go ahead. Otherwise, wait for a sidewalk sale or penny sale!
Shame on the director for doing so little with so much! Review Title: For so many stars, it's a little slow Rating: 3.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Standard Deviants School - Basic Math, Program 7 - Fraction Basics (Classroom Edition) Standard Deviants School (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Special Interests ['The Standard Deviants set the groundwork for learning fractions. They cover fraction terms, common factors, and reducing fractions. Everything you need to start working with fractions!'] {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Multiple Formats, Color', 'Run time': '7 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 15, 2004', 'Actors': 'Standard Deviants School', 'Studio': 'Cerebellum Corp', 'Number of discs': '1'} Well, I had heard that the Standard Deviants items had changed a lot after being purchased by
a new company. This is apparently very true!

NEVER, NEVER, NEVER pay the full price for one of these DVD's. By that, I mean if you pay over $10
total, you'll feel a little ripped off.

Apparently, what the new owners have done is take their basic instruction and break it down into
infinitesimal sections in order to sell more DVD's. If you think this will give your child a good
overview of fractions, you will be disappointed.

The DVD itself was fine. Mine had little lines across the bottom, but I suspect that might have been
because this was for a regular screen and I have a widescreen, but not sure.

What is un-be-freakin-lievable is that this DVD is only SEVEN MINUTES long! Yup - infomercials are longer.
What this DOES do is introduce the CONCEPT of fractions. It explains what a fraction is, what numerators
and denominators are, how to get a common denominator (but that isn't explained well, IMHO. As an adult, it was
easy, but if a kid was watching this, I am not so sure they would really get it). It also explained equivalent
fractions (as in, why 1/3, 2/6 and 4/12 are all basically the same fraction of 1/3). It shows via pie charts
which might help a child visualize hat they are talking about with a fraction.

But, that is where the instruction ends. Abruptly.
It does not show how to multiply fractions, which was the "fraction basic" info that I was hoping for
when I purchased this DVD.

All in all, this was disappointing. I'd bought 3 SD Math Basic DVD's, and really wasn't looking at the length.
NONE of the newer DVD's run very long, and are apparently broken into so many sub-sets of information that you'll
end up having to buy a lot of their DVD's (and they hope spending a lot of money) to get all the basic information.
This shows a real greedy side to the company, in my opinion. Just make a DVD about fractions, period.
Don't make me buy 2 or 3 of the DVD's to get good fraction information for a child who is having a rough
time with the fraction concept.

This is better than nothing, but that's all. You could make your own pie charts at home just as effectively,
or use cookies laid out in a clock format, etc, something that kids can relate to. The only benefit to this short
DVD is that the kid can watch it any time s/he wants to without your being involved.
Don't pay full price for these, because it definitely isn't worth it. Great for what it is... profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Educational Focus:** The user appreciates educational materials, particularly for teaching concepts like fractions in a clear and engaging manner.
- **Value-Conscious:** They express a strong preference for value, emphasizing skepticism towards full-priced items and critical of perceived commercial exploitation in product offerings.
- **Expectation Management:** The user expects comprehensive coverage of topics, indicating disappointment when products fall short, particularly for children struggling with subjects.
- **Skeptical of Edutainment:** They critique the trend of breaking educational content into smaller, costly segments, favoring consolidated, thorough explanations over fragmented materials.
- **Practical Learning Tools:** The user values hands-on, relatable methods for teaching complex concepts, indicating a preference for innovative learning approaches beyond standard materials.
- **Mixed Reviews on Quality:** While acknowledging content quality, they critique brevity and depth, suggesting a fair yet critical evaluation of educational products.
- **Entertainment Preferences:** Recently, the user demonstrated a preference for romantic comedies with star-studded casts, though they expressed disappointment in the execution of plots. They enjoy the genre but seek deeper, more engaging stories and are cautious about paying full price, indicating a consistent value-centric mindset.

Overall, the user prioritizes effective, comprehensive, and affordable educational and entertainment resources while being wary of marketing tactics that prioritize profit over content quality.
